item.description:
http://www.rogerwilli...

I think that you have to pay the admission to the zoo. Maybe we'll plan on gathering for lunch or something before or after everyone browses on their own. I've never been to the zoo so excited about this:)

more info than this on the website:

# ENVIRONMENTAL FAIR!!
Featuring these environmental organizations from around the state, 11 a.m. - 3 p.m.:

o Natural Resources Conservation Service
o Narragansett Bay Research
o Earth Our Only Home
o Environmental Council of RI
o RI Energy Office
o RIPTA
o RI Resource Recovery
o URI Master Energy Program
o Environmental Stewardship Task Force
o URI Master Composters and Recycles
o Ocean State Environmental Education Collaborative AmeriCorps Program,
Recycling for RI Education and Save the Bay
o The Providential Gardener
o Ocean Project
o Groundwork Providence - Trees 2020 Program
o US EPA
o Childhood Lead Action Project
o Norman Bird Sanctuary
o check back soon for more participants!

# Other activities & fun from 11 a.m. - 3 p.m.:
- Create a recycled paper flower garden with artist Gillian Christy
- Help to construct a birdhouse from found objects,with environmental artist Will Machin
- Help to draw a chalk rendering of our local watershed with artist Anna Shapiro
- Create origami cranes from recycled paper with artist Jessica Langella
item.name: Earth Day Festivities at Roger Williams Park Zoo
